content.description:
The following questions refer to this passage:

Saepius ventis agitatur ingens

pinus et celsae graviore casu

decidunt turres feriuntque summos

fulgura montes.

(5) Sperat infestis, metuit secundis

alteram sortem bene praeparatum

pectus. Informes hiemes reducit

Iuppiter; idem

summovet. . . .
content.question:
In the passage above, Horace makes two related observations on the theme of "the golden mean."
(a) In lines 5-9 (Sperat . . . summovet), Horace uses pairs of words to illustrate opposites. Write out and translate one of these pairs of opposites. 
(b) Briefly explain how this pair of contrasting words relates to the theme.
